body.p: Images are very important in any printed material. In this section you will see how you can refer them from your HTML or your XML documents.
For HTML, the img tag is recognized as image without any other styling in your CSS files:
body.codeblock:
...

And this is the picture of a happy face: .

...
body.p: For XML, you must add CSS rules that pick up the content of an attribute and use it as source for an image.
body.codeblock: ... <para> And this is the picture of a happy face: <imagedata fileref="happy.png"/>.</para> ...
body.p: We use a static content, on the imagedata before pseudo element:
It is important to use the url keyword when retrieving the attribute value, it signals that the value is a pointer to an external image.
